message: Hi ! Just push my branch for grid templates.. Hope everything is fine !
if we can get sontek's pulled in, then we can pull that over to our permissions work and wrap the template code with permissions stuff
also it would allow @grobolom's feature detail stuff to be updated with that approach
what do you think about keeping it separate in grid_detail2.html vs cherry-picking carefully and carefully merging it into grid_detail.html while fixing css issues
@audreyr I spent a while reviewing all the pull requests this morning (and putting in a few more)
I'd have to see the actual use case myself
your call, I'd consider leaving it a separate for now, and then just doing a git mv commit later to put it in place
I see that, awesome
ok, that's what I was wondering :)
And since we all agree that the current Package model has too many fields, we need to make some architecture changes.
ok sure
don't know if @pydanny still has an issue with my use of satanic generic exception still or not - but that pull also involves a migration
I just checked with him, he still thinks it's satanic
alright. reviewing @sontek's grid pull request now.
The issue is that the PSF and others are asking for various things.
My concept of tons of abstract models would mean that the Package model would be different for each installation, which would make maintenance a nightmare
Unless... we switched to MongoDB. HA HA HA HA HA HA
Hey @ptone, I wanted to discuss https://github.com/cartwheelweb/packaginator/pull/23
We were supposed to start client work 30 minutes ago but are trying to handle pull requests for you guys. Anyway, this is a lot more fun. :)

I'm going to spend a full day thinking about the directions of things, but right now I'm leaning towards @ptone's idea of having all PyPI information in the pypi app - which would mean models with a one-to-one relation with Packages
There's a ton of really good code here by @sontek. I'm still reviewing, just taking the time to understand everything
ha ha
(nothing against MongoDB but there is no reason to consider that approach)
@paparent Cool, we'll get to reviewing it shortly
@pydanny I'll postpone some thoughts about the decoupling of PyPi from package model till you have some more personal bandwidth freed up :-)
Fun for me too :) well, kinda repetitive task but, it must be done. I'm attacking the package templates
99.2% test coverage in grid.views : )
@pydanny doh - didn't have my eyes on convore
Thanks @ptone. As I said, your approach is probably better than my own.
@grobolom sweet, that's gonna help us a lot very very soon when we get the new and improved grids into production
Hey all, at 2pm we're leaving for lunch and will be out the rest of the day. Any pull requests that don't get reviewed by then will be reviewed tomorrow.

Okay @sontek's changes are merged into trunk. I commented out the line in grid/urls.py pointing it to grid_detail2.html, with a note that if you are working on grids, to uncomment and use the new rotated grids
@paparent, your i18n work is up for review in the @audreyr review queue, hang on
@audreyr ok cool :) I'm about to push the main templates (base and homepage)
@audreyr issued a pull request on permissions. I think it is clean : )
@pydanny awesome!
@grobolom ok will try to get to to it asap!
tell me this doesn't rock? http://readthedocs.org/docs/packaginator/en/latest/reference.html
We got to as much as we could but need to sign off to eat and work on some regular client work.  But we'll be back reviewing pull requests as soon as we can tomorrow.
Thanks so much to everyone for keeping us so busy with all the pull requests.  It's really amazing.
We take our time with each pull request, making sure that we understand every part before it goes into trunk, which is why it takes so long.
